metadata.title: De Havilland Canada Dash 8
aws::graph::propositions: De Havilland Canada Dash 8 Manufacturing and Orders
The Calgary site produced DHC-6 Twin Otters.
The Calgary site was originally envisioned as the venue for Dash 8 production.
Bombardier made a property transaction prior to the 2019 sale to De Havilland Canada (DHC).
DHC decommissioned its Downsview, Toronto, manufacturing facility in August 2022.
DHC confirmed its plans to restart Dash 8 production in Wheatland County, Alberta in 2023.
Wheatland County is located outside of Calgary.
DHC plans to restart Dash 8 production by 2033.
DHC announced orders for seven Series 400 aircraft at the Farnborough International Airshow in July 2024.
Skyward Express ordered one Series 400 aircraft.
Tanzania Government Flight Agency ordered one Series 400 aircraft.
DHC announced the launch of a factory refurbishment programme at the Farnborough International Airshow in July 2024.
DHC purchased 28 aircraft for the factory refurbishment programme.
DHC developed new freighter conversion kits.
DHC developed new combi aircraft conversion kits.
Advantage Air ordered one combi aircraft conversion kit.

topics.value: De Havilland Canada Dash 8 Manufacturing and Orders

statements.value: The Calgary site produced DHC-6 Twin Otters.

Wheatland County is located outside of Calgary.

DHC announced orders for seven Series 400 aircraft at the Farnborough International Airshow in July 2024.

details: combi aircraft conversion kits STATUS new

statements.value: Advantage Air ordered one combi aircraft conversion kit.

text:
The Calgary site, where the company produced DHC-6 Twin Otters, was originally envisioned as the venue for Dash 8 production.
Per a property transaction made by Bombardier prior to the 2019 sale to DHC, DHC decommissioned its Downsview, Toronto, manufacturing facility in August 2022, and in 2023 confirmed its plans to restart Dash 8 production in Wheatland County, Alberta, outside of Calgary, by 2033.
At the Farnborough International Airshow in July 2024, DHC announced orders for seven Series 400 aircraft, including one for Skyward Express, two for Widerøe, and one for the Tanzania Government Flight Agency. The company also announced the launch of a factory refurbishment programme, for which 28 aircraft had been purchased, along with new freighter and combi aircraft conversion kits; one of the latter had been ordered by Advantage Air, DHC said.
